SENT.plain: The aim of this study was to determine whether neurotrophin-4/5 (NT-4/5) treatment alters infarction volume following permanent focal cerebral ischemia in the rat
Permanent focal cerebral ischemia was produced in adult male rats by intraluminal occlusion of the right middle cerebral artery
NT-4/5 was administered intraventricularly one day before and immediately following occlusion
Rats were sacrificed at 1, 4 and 7 days after occlusion
NT-4/5 treatment reduced infarction volume by 34% when compared to control rats 1 day after occlusion
Infarction volume was unaltered by treatment 4 to 7 days after occlusion
Middle cerebral artery occlusion led to a significant reduction in levels of mRNAs coding for catalytic and truncated TrkB receptors
This expression was unaffected by NT-4/5 treatment
